Description: Whether the TCP connection is available.
Interpretation: An availability problem can be caused by different factors - e.g., the server process may not be up, a network problem may exist, or there could be a configuration problem with the DNS server.

Description: Time taken (in seconds) by the server to respond to a request.
Interpretation: An increase in response time can be caused by several factors such as a server bottleneck, a configuration problem with the DNS server, a network problem, etc.
